title.text: Segmenting Temporal Intervals for Tense and Aspect

abstractContent.text: Timelines interpreting interval temporal logic formulas are segmented into strings which serve as semantic representations for tense and aspect.

entities.text: Timelines interpreting interval temporal logic formulas

abstractContent.text: The strings have bounded but refinable granularity, suitable for analyzing (im)perfectivity, dura-tivity, telicity, and various relations including branching.

introductionContent.text: A sentence in the simple past, such as (1a), uttered at (speech) time Scan be pictured as a timeline (1b), describing an event E (Ernest explaining) prior to S.
